kinematics: study of motion without considering its causes
inertia: the tendency of an object to resist changes in its motion
power: rate at which work is done
buoyancy: upward force exerted by a fluid
capacitance: ability of a system to store electric charge
conductivity: measure of a material's ability to conduct electricity
faraday effect: rotation of the plane of polarization of light in a magnetic field
frequency: number of wave cycles per unit time
